Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, best value”
Reviews.Author: biutza
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Paris to celebrate his birthday and our 6th year anniversary together. Tourisme hotel was the best hotel we could find for our holiday as it was cheap,nice and clean(they were cleaning the room every day, clean towels every day also) very near to the metro station (across the road,), a lot of restaurants on the same street, 10 minutes walking distance to Eiffel Tower. We had a double bed (not two twins together),which was great and very comfortable.What to wish more then that? We used to go to the italian restaurant, I forgot the name,but they have very good food and nice & helpful staff.(it is located opposite"Le Suffren").We went twice to "Le Suffren"(they have good tasted mussles),but in the same time we found the restaurant too expensive. So, afterall, if we will go back to Paris, we will choose Tourisme Hotel again. Oh,and I almost forgot, one of the best thing is, the staff are very helpful and very nice,despite what I heard about french people, most of them have spoken english pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “10steps from metro station!”
Reviews.Author: annie_e_obolo
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in the city center. price is quite reasonable. it is quite near to eifel tower tower but i would suggest to take train. buy the daily pass. the hotel room is nice, clean and comfortable. breakfast is not included. however there are a few bakery and patries nearby. i would say yes to this hotel. easy acess, in the ity center and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very well located for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: Guaip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Eiffel Tower and there are lots of convenience stores nearby (Starbucks just next door, a supermarket, McDonalds, restaurants, a street with lots of shops, three metro lines, etc). We got two rooms: one new and renovated, the other a bit older, but both very comfortable for the price (specially in Paris where hotels are usually pretty expensive). Would recomend for sure. The only major problem is the metro noise that may be an issue for some people.

Reviews.Title: “A practical 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaby_stec
Reviews.Content: A practical hotel, located very close to Eiffel Tower. Metro station (lines 8 and 6) near the hotel. Many restaurants nearby. Restaurant "Le Suffren" (seafood) nearby. Rooms have air conditioning!

Reviews.Title: “Third visit, still a gem!”
Reviews.Author: kryptful
Reviews.Content: First stay in this hotel was three years back, it was a gem back then, it still is a gem tucked right behind the Eiffel Tower today! Pretty much nothing has changed from since 2009, except they have changed the locks (key to key-card), I was given a slightly bigger double room this time round, with more space to move about, and part of the hotel is still undergoing renovation works, but no big issue. Since it was winter, the hotel pretty much turned off the aircon, and had the heater turned on, which made it a little stuffy at nights. Had to wake up at times in the middle of the night to keep the windows open for awhile, then close them again before heading back to sleep. There still was free wireless (but only for one equipment) and hot showers, the two supermarkets right at the cross junctions are also still there (together with MacD's, can't miss it!), however the nice little cafe/restaurant just steps away from the hotel (right next to Starbucks) has closed down, they were under renovations when I was still there two weeks back. But fret not, there are still two cafes/ restaurants (Suffren and Le Picquet, if I remember correctly- LP is a a must-try!) just down the road the hotel is located on, good on the days I was lazy to venture out further for food. Subway/ RER ride to Orly airport took about 40 minutes that early morning I left, but journey from CDG took considerably longer, I think it was more than an hour. Another plus- the hotel's website offers good deals if your stay is booked earlier, stay three/ five nights for a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “noise = blustery wind.. don't let it put you off..”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic; right near the Eiffel tower. I walked, with kids, to Musee Orsay and the National History Museum both night and day and always felt safe. The Hotel rooms are brand new, spotless and extremely comfortable. There is still a bit of work on the corridors being done, but the rooms are impeccable. Some people have noted that the rooms are noisy, it is I suppose true, (I was on floor 1 directly over of the metro entrance) but the noise is nothing worse than a blustery wind. After one or two metro passings we were all fast asleep until the morning anyway. I thoroughly recommend if travelling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Laineylane
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and myself stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in August 2011 before heading to Scotland. This was our third trip to Paris and because we were only going for a long weekend, we just wanted something in a good location for a good price. After some research on TripAdvisor, we opted for the Tourisme Hotel...and we were not disappointed! We got a good rate and a room that met all of our needs. Of course it wasn't a large room (we're in Paris after all), but it was more than sufficient for 3 people and we never once felt cramped. The room was clean and modern, very "modular" in design. My daughter loved the built-in bed she got, and I was pleased that it wasn't an uncomfortable, little cot that was rolled in. The beds were comfortable, but as I recall, the pillows weren't great. Still - they never interfered with our sleep. The hotel staff was professional and helpful; the elevator was in good working order; the hallways have retained an old-world parisienne flair; the dining area was very clean and efficient; the TV/sitting area was a convenient place to check email; and there was a Starbucks right next door - perfect! The view isn't great, and it's not in the most glamorous neighbourhood, but the location was perfect: turn left out the door and walk straight until you come to the Eiffel Tower in about 4 blocks - perfect! If I were staying in the city for a week or more, I may splurge again for a hotel with a better view and ambiance, but for a short-term stay at an excellent rate, I will definately return to Tourisme Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location... a MUST”
Reviews.Author: Melaina J
Reviews.Content: We had a clean room and a comfortable bed and a great staff. We didn't really want to spend much on a hotel as we would only be there to sleep. It was just about perfect! The one thing that could potentially bother some light sleepers is the METRO rattled our room every 10 minutes until midnight or so; but after we slept it didn't bother us at all :o). We walked to the Tower at night and enjoyed the view. When we come back for a visit to do other touristy stuff we will for sure be booking here again! LOTS of wonderful places to eat that is in walking distance. Parking was an issue! We had to pay 30 euros for overnight parking. There was no place to park within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Yani08
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms last December. The hotel is in a good location. A short walk to the Eiffel tower. There are plenty of bistros, restaurants near the hotel. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because we wanted to try different places, I'm glad we did because it would have been more expensive. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very helpful. We checked out in the morning but they were able to hold our luggage until 6pm, we really appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “FABBBB! Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmzyb
Reviews.Content: this hotel has everything you need, about 10 mins max from the eiffel tower, shops and rests all around, we walked to natre dame the louvre and more. had news years here was great. friendly and helpful staff. a must stay and i will be coming back!!! great!! oh and went on a boat tour on sein for 11 euros!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 792Marty_Wilson
Reviews.Content: Tourisme Hotel has been a great location to explore Paris from. It is extremely close to the metro, the rooms are clean and rather spacious for Paris. It is located right near some great cafes and is only a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. The free wifi was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Captain_0veur
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice in the last two years. As others have noted the Location is very convinient. There is a Metro station right outside. There are some Restaurants near by with decent value (at least for Paris) and the Eiffel Tower is about 15 min. by foot. Rooms are small, but normal for Paris. The first time I stayed there we got a really good rate. The second time (May 2011) the price was higher but still good value. The Room and Bathroom were clean, certainly cleaner than in other places in Paris I stayed before. Noise was ok, considering the proximity to the metro and big intersection. Apparently they were doing some renovations, e.g. there were cables hanging from the ceiling. So all in all there is nothing special but certainly above average for Paris, with good value and good location.There are some other places which have might be better, but we never managed to get a room there. Would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: seattlite_8608
Reviews.Content: What could be better than a 10 minute walk to see the Eiffel Tower twinkling every night? This hotel met all of our needs and the front desk was very helpful. There is a Starbucks next door, McDonald's for a quick meal if everything else is closed, and good panini's available in the area. Outside is the metro with connections for the entire area so the location is excellent. We picked the best hotel in the best location for our first trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value-great location”
Reviews.Author: IrishEyesSA
Reviews.Content: Could not complain about this hotel . We had a double room on the second floor which was spacious, clean with a comfortable bed and the en-suite was a good size - in fact great value for the money. Breakfast which cost 9 euros is OK but you can get better value at Le Pierrot Bistrot just across the road. There are plenty of good restaurants either side of the hotel and the metro is just across the road with a 24 hour McDonalds if you like fast food. easy walk to the Eiffel Tower where you can catch the Paris Hop on off bus, the metro is good and easy to use and a day trip ticket is good value. The staff speak good English and are very helpful. Would defiantly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Central and conveniently located hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: saa73
Reviews.Content: We chose this mainly for the central location, accrssibility and next to main convenience stores. We were right there on the main intersection, above the Metro La motte-picquet grenelle which is a main hub that gets you to the main attractions in minutes (even Versailles was 30 mins away). 10 mins walk to the Eiffel tower, and another 10 to Invalides, you can't beat this for location. Don't bother with the hotel's 7 Euro breakfast..you can just walk down to Starbucks, the little chococate shop or the many street corner cafes for breakfast, or even buy food from the Monoprix (supermarket) or Franprix. There is even a greengrocers across the street, and for the health conscious, the hotel is next to Fitness First. Our room (104) was decently sized, with the toilet separate from bathroom. Yes, we are above the Metro, so you get the rumbles every few minutes..and being at a traffic intersection, it is noisy if you open the window ..which we had to do every day because our no smoking room actually had a faint whiff of smoke ( but oddly, our bathroom smelled of baked pastry every morning!). But the windows are soundproof and shuts out the noise well when closed. In summary, this hotel itself was nothing to shout about, i guess the room was much bigger than what i stayed in previously 5 years ago..there is a security box/safe which was a plus point..but it is in an excellent location and you can walk out every night to see the Eiffel Tower lit up if you wished!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good value!”
Reviews.Author: Quietcreek
Reviews.Content: Our triple room was recently redone in modern decor and a newer 40-inch TV. The room has a small bathroom with curtain that separates the shower area. Last week of August the Paris temperature was comfy, still aircondition was useful to keep the noise level low for good night sleep, especially in this busy neigbourhood location. This hotel is superbly located within 10-15 minutes walk to the Eiffel tower where you also easily can get the bus #69 for a cheap alternative bus tour around Paris. Metro station at the corner and right in front of the hotel which runs up to past midnight. There is a Starbuck's next to this hotel and McDonalds just around the corner. Amazingly, there is a good size grocery store across the street where you can get your bottled water, fruits and daily needs. Our only concern was the free WI-FI access at times slow and unuseable. Staff was helpful and nice. This hotel was truely part of our Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: world1201
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel in Paris. It is very close to the metro, and you can kinda hear the trains but it is not overly loud or annoying. The owners appear to be updating the hotel and remodeling. Our room felt very modern. It was very clean, had a flat screen TV, and a nice bathroom. I stayed here with my father and we had plenty of space for the two of us. It is maybe a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. This makes it very easy to take an late night stroll and see the tower all lit up and watch all of the people enjoying their evenings. The front desk was staffed by nice and polite workers. We got a pretty reasonable price and I think we got a very good deal. Overall I was pleased and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed unlikely to stay there again but good location”
Reviews.Author: jassoun
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 10 year old son. Parts of the upper bathroom was very very dusty....unpleasantly so. I found the opening doors dangerous in my opinion for children but the service desk did not seem very bothered.....it was high up and the was a balcony. The doors suddenly opened when my son lent on them. The breakfast was poor value but good quality and very helpful staff. There were some strange wires and flooring. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “super clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: almo52
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the tourisme hotel while attending roland garros this spring. walked out the door and got the metro directly there, or anywhere for that matter. the hotel is super clean, our room was above the main street, but we got used to the noise. if you can request a quiet room, do it! we walked to the eiffel tower, champs elysee's, all over. very safe at all hours. lots to eat around the hotel too, starbuck's, mcdonald's, small bakery, several restaurants, a super market. my husband and i highly recommend this hotel. the price is right too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: laureng_33
Reviews.Content: The rating for this review is based on the room - not the hotel itself. The location is great, less than a 10min walk to the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are decent size for Paris and the bathroom appeared to be recently renovated. HOWEVER, our room was right above the metro. We heard and felt it go by every 7 minutes starting at 5am. My husband and I never got a decent sleep while we were at this hotel because of this. If you are given a room where you can feel the metro go by, my advice would be to switch. There are dozens of hotels in this area and I'm sure any of the other ones would be just as good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and I would stay there again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: LorenaMarques
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel as soon as we got there. It is really close to the subway, there are restaurants and stores, like GAP and Occitane around, and it is close enough to go by foot to the Eiffel Tower (+- 15 minutes). Everybody from the reception were very helpful - they gave us some tips about restaurants, foods, how to get to some places, etc. The rooms are very good, a lot of space to put your clothes, baggages and all your stuffs. The Bathroom is not too small. The breakfast is a little expensive (9 euros), but it is ok. The only think that was disturbing was the light from the windownin the morning, as the rooms dont have blackout. An other think that is they dont have small refrigerator in the rooms. I stayd there with my booyfriend and another couple. We all reallly liked and Ieven recommeded it to my mom, that stayd there with a friend. If I were in Paris again, I would not hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION and LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: navigator_th
Reviews.Content: We are so happy to choose this hotel. The renovation is done so our room is nice and clean. We got a 3-bed room instead of twin bed superior room which is OK. The room is quite big for Europe standard but the bathroom is quite small. The window lock is good. We don't hear anything from the road. There is a safe-box in the closet and easy to use. Free WiFi works well with our iPad2. The best thing is its location. 3 Metro lines are just right in front of hotel so you can go anywhere in Paris so fast. From CDG airport, you can take RER, change to Metro and walk 50 m. to hotel in 1 hour. There is a big supermarket opposite to the hotel where you can buy water, fruits and everything easily. You don't really need to have breakfast which is NOT free at the hotel because you can buy them anywhere around hotel. A lot of nice restaurants and cafes are within 5 mins walk including McDonald and Starbucks. There is also the market every Sunday and Wednesday morning on Bd de Grenelle just 50 m from the hotel. They have fresh fruits, french food and so many stuffs. It's fun and we LOVE it. About 500 m. from hotel on Ave de la Lamott-Picquet , Rue Cler has a lot of restaurants, cafes, pastry shops and everything for tourists. Should check them out. A shop on Ave de la Lamott-Picquet opposite to Rue Cler sells Paris Museum Pass as well. You can walk to Eiffel Tower in 10 mins. It's quite safe when I walked back to hotel alone around 10:30 pm after seeing the tower with the light. The staffs are helpful, nice and able to speak English very well. It's a good value for what we pay. We will definitely stay in this hotel again. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, value for money”
Reviews.Author: nicosma13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Everything was in oredr, the rooms were clean with every day cleaning service. There was a part with new rooms which had a trendy look.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LonnaLinda
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 2 star hotel which the rooms have been recently redone since we could slightly smell fresh paint. We had a group of 6 staying so booked 3 junior suites. Suite 115 had the toilet separated from the shower, the other two suites had toilet in the shower area. That would be the only reason I would give this hotel a 4.5 out of 5 stars only because we had no shower curtain so taking showers meant the toilet and surrounding area got wet. Slightly bothersome but just a minor issue. Bring your own shampoo and conditioner as they do not provide. The suite was a very good size with 2 twin beds pushed together, plenty of closet space and 2 comfortable chairs. Beautiful décor – modern/trendy. I would have liked a coffee maker in the room; however note there is a Starbucks next door and McDonalds just around the corner if you must have a cup of coffee in the AM before venturing out. Coffee at the McDonalds (which surprisingly was quite good) was only 1.40 Euro’s for 2 large cups. The metro entrance is right in front of the hotel; however if you need to purchase tickets you must do so about 1 block from the hotel. Staff was excellent and helpful with all our needs. Hotel is still under renovation in the hallways but had NO noise what so ever from any work being done. While our room faced the front street we heard little noise from the outside – the double paned windows are excellent in keeping noise to a very low level. The room has air conditioning which was awesome – just the right temp as 3 of the days we stayed in Paris hit the high 80’s. Free wi-fi which works very well. Also large hotel elevator if you don't want to take the stairs. Every morning we had breakfast at Le Pierrot which was excellent and just across the street from the hotel. For 7.80 Euro (Café Francais) we had coffee, juice, delicious croissant and bread with jam/butter. Less expensive than the hotel breakfast and it was nice to sit in an open area to watch people on the street while we ate. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel for the value and beautiful room décor, size of the junior suite and location to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good decent hotel in a nice french neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: mel7155
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this hotel. The hotel staff were very helpful. We were able to eat at a 3 star Michelin Restaurant because the staff booked for us 2 months in advance before we even stayed at the hotel. The rooms are functional and clean. We got the large double room with a tub and it was okay if you just want to come back and rest. You are in Paris, so you are unlikely to spend most of your time in the room. The place is newly renovated so is good value. The place have many eating spots and is highly accessible with the taxi stand just outside the hotel. If coming back to Paris, I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin20
Reviews.Content: A very nice place right in the heart of Paris. The Eiffel Tower is just 10 minutes away walking. The staff is friendly and the rooms are large and clean. The only problem is breakfast: don't buy it when you book, because it's very and expensive and poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBookworm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Close to the Eiffel Tower and metro station literally right outside the door. There are plenty of good cafes around and it seemed like a very safe neighborhood. We didn't pay for the breakfast because there is a great pastry shop two doors down where you can breakfast. Our room was an adequate size for 2 people. It was a little weird that there wasn't a shower curtain on the shower, but otherwise the room was great. I would stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: monygrl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a 5 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. We went there every night to watch it twinkle. The neighborhood feels very safe and not touristy. plenty of restaurants close by. On Sunday they had a market across the street. Taxi stand right outside the door and a metro station for getting around. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Paris. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: cwgedge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a good neighborhood just minutes away from the Eiffel Tower and next to several metro lines to bring you around the city. However, my experience at the hotel overshadowed the convenience and I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone. The accommodations are tight; we stayed in a triple room. The beds were decent but the bathroom was very small, no room for more than one person at a time. There was no shower stall - just a curtain that wrapped around the bathroom corner which didn't prevent the bathroom from getting soaked Every day we were given towels for 2 people despite the fact that we were in a triple room with 3 people. We had to ask the receptionist every day for more towels and were given attitude. One night we asked for another set and the receptionist refused to give us towels by responding that "we should have asked sooner" given it was 10PM…we had left the hotel at 7AM that morning...after arguing with him he reluctantly disappeared and came back with another set of towels. I asked the receptionist to help me make a restaurant reservation. She called once, didn't get an answer, and gave me the phone number to try again later. She didn't offer to try again, she told me to try again. This hotel is a value if you don't mind rude staff and being treated poorly. I have stayed at 4 different hotels in Paris and I decided on this one because it offered a value triple room. This is the first hotel review I have written and I am not a snotty customer and I have reasonable expectations for what I pay for. But I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone. If you are looking for value, I have stayed at hostels that treat their customers better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location just under the Eiffel!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLouise10-71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for the price we paid! The staff were very helpful, breakfast was only a croissant and a bread roll but this is typical of Paris! Metro station just out the front door was very convenient! The bathroom was tiny but the room was an OK size, overall it was an enjoyable experience and amazing to see the Eiffel every day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and service”
Reviews.Author: kingpatrick7
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Eiffel Tower and directly in front of metro station. Great service. Clean, recently upgraded rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: RivTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located withing steps of a metro station in a great part of town. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and right next to a great pastry shop. The price was very good for the classic and superior rooms we booked. The rooms are clean and quite large for a Paris hotel. The staff was helpful in booking a taxi on the day of our departure which was nice to not have to deal with. I would stay here again on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: pyap
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris and I would definitely recommend this hotel. As the previous review, the renovation is almost completed and it didn't bother us much. I would recommend the walk to Eiffel Tower via Champ de Mars simply because you be able to get a nice view of Eiffel Tower as you are walking towards it. We came from CDG Airport and we took the RER-B, change to metro Denfert Rochereau then take the metro line 6 towards CDG Etoile until La Motte-Picquet/Grenelle which took us about 1hr 15 mins. We reached very early of the day and we were galdly surpised that we could check-in to our rooms. We were required to leave the keys when we leave the hotel but don't worry, the reception is open 24hrs. There is a supermarket across the road, which Starbucks and some patisseries around this hotel, therefore it is quite easy to get breakfast, food and water. We were actually contemplating to choose a hotel near Notre Dame or Eiffel Tower and we were glad that we make a choice by staying near Eiffel Tower as we could walk there especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Valokaari
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girlfriend for 5 nights in the begining of February 2011. After reading the reviews on this site about the Hotel being under renovation I was expecting the worst. But I was pleasantly surprised when I saw that it seems the renovation was nearing its end. I could see only one room in our floor that was under work and we did not hear any sounds of work in the morning. The room was clean but a little bit small though I would say just big enough for two people not intending to spend that much time in the room. The bed was a double bed and big enough so we did not have to fight for space. Bathroom was also quite nice and not too small. The air-conditioning did not work well but luckily you can open the window. The room had a flat-screen tv with many channels. Almost all of the channels had programming that was either French or was dubbed bud there were a couple of English, German and Spanish channels. Also the hotel has a free wi-fi but you had to ask the login-information from the front desk. Worked well when I used it. The hotel is located in a great location. You can be at the Eiffel tower in about 10-15min of walking and the elevated La Motte-Picquet - Grenelle metro station is across the street. You can be at Champs-Èlysèes in about 10min with the metro or you can take a little walk to for example Les Invalides if you prefer it. There are many, many cafe's and restaurants very close. We did not try the breakfast at the hotel as we found a nice little pastry shop / cafe at the corner of one of the intersections on the Boulevard de Grenelle. Also from the hotel on the other side of Boulevard de Grenelle (next to the McD) starts Rue du Commerce which is a little charming shopping street. So there are many nice things really close to the hotel but thanks to the good metro network of Paris you can also go to different place quite quickly. So to summarize. The hotel is great and located in a great place. Hotel staff spoke fluent English and were very helpful. For a two-star hotel this was a good and a pleasant experience. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and if going to Paris a second time I would consider going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of sketchy...”
Reviews.Author: bbinnyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel wouldn't even respond to repeated attempts to contact for a reservation. Even after deciding to try to call the hotel and follow-up on my email attempts, they said "try to email again" and wouldn't let me make a RSVP over the phone!!! They also require credit card info on their site when emailing about a rate/day inquiry... not a reservation, credit card info for just an inquiry about availability/price/etc!!!! I was amazed. I wouldn't be surprised if some sketchy charges start showing up on my credit card bill thanks to my attempt to stay here. If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is... You might pay a little more to stay slightly farther away from the Eiffel Tower, but i'd say you'd have less of a headache and your credit card will be safer for it. Avoid! PS to Staff People-- If you're full... just say so. And if you've missed responding to a customer, just apologize. It won't hurt you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location,spacious room but no free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MarcusAu
Reviews.Content: The location is very good as it's lesser than 100 metres to the nearest Metro station. It is also walking distance about 20 minutes walk to Eiffel Tower.The room is spacious for triple room with a large LCD tv. The receptionist is friendly and can speak good English. This hotel was under renovation during our stay for 3 nights from 28th to 30th Dec 2010 and I trust they do so in order to upgrade the facilities to look new. Hence,I did not have any complaint about it although I could smell the paint and see one of the rooms near to our room was under renovation. In addition to it, it has lift which I think it's not common to find lift in 2 star hotel in Paris. The bad thing about this hotel is we have to pay for breakfast if we want to have it in the hotel.We did try once and it's just normal breakfast which was not extraordinary. The restaurant serving the breakfast is clean and looks cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable; Good Location”
Reviews.Author: christineMalaysia
Reviews.Content: For a reasonable 80 Euros a night for 2, Tourisme Hotel was a comfortable stay. As they had warned about the renovations beforehand, I was prepared for it though it did not bother me as I was out for most of the day. While the room was clean, I did however find it to be quite stuffy and had to open the windows during the evenings for more ventilation. As the room was facing the street, it did have some noise but I had no problems sleeping through it. The location of this hotel was key for me; just outside a Metro station and surrounded by restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “our 4 night stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravellingSOmuch
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the Tripadvisor Reviews. I was very skeptical when we arrived. Because the walk-in of the hotel doesn't look very nice because they are busy building and renovating etc. But when we arrived in our room it was really nice. It is clean, and just what you need. I'm very full of crap when it comes to rooms. I dont sleep in bedding if it is not white :) And I will never ever stay in a 2 star Hotel. But this one is by far not a 2 star. Can definitely be a 3 star (but only in the room- not around the hotel)? We didn’t have breakfast. The bathrooms was big enough, only shower not bath. - we really enjoyed our stay. Just a pity that there is no coffee making facilities in the rooms. Only plastic glasses. But overall, everyday our room was cleaned and we had no issues. Room number 312. Our view outside was not nice. Just look into a court yard or something. But it is better, because there is no noise. The hotel staff was also very nice. Very helpful. I would definitely stay here again if we stay in Paris again. the Metro is just outside the door. so travelling is very easy. and there is nice Restaurants around hotel as well. I believe in a few months this hotel will look stunning, when they are finished with their renovations.

Reviews.Title: “disaster area - completely under construction - bad smell too”
Reviews.Author: PDXtraveller707
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel was torn to shreds when we arrived, no elevator, openings in walls, floors and ceilings, exposed wires hanging in bundles, armies of workmen . . .a total disaster. . . and the smell of damp carpets. mold, mildew and mice in the hallway was overpowering. . . the room itself looked ok once we made it through the ladders and construction. . . only to discover that the smell of mildew was just as strong in our bathroom, incredibly bad smell . . . there is something seriously wrong in this hotel. We fled as soon as we could find another place - went to the Splendid Hotel about 4 blocks away, where, for the same money we had a gorgeous, clean, quiet, good-smelling room with a view of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant stay ! Definitely will be back !”
Reviews.Author: vitamin_kin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tourisme had made our first visit to Paris a wonderful experience. The hotel is located very near the Metro and RER. It is not far from the effiel tower, about 20 minutes walking distance if u stroll leisurely. A lovely patisserie is just outside the hotel and Mcdonald is just at opposite the street. Nice restuarants at affordable prices is available near the hotel. The staffs were friendly and helpful. The room is clean and comfortable. Bathroom is also clean. We had a pleasant 4 nights stay at the hotel. They just upgraded the lift. Although there were renovation works going on but it did not affect us at all. We took a peek at the new rooms, they are nicely done up. Very modern!We are already looking forward to our next stay here in Paris! The only minus point about the hotel is the WIFI connection, It fails to connect in our room, probably due to low signal. But we can bring our notebook to surf at the breakfast room. We will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Wa1ker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just outside the train station, which is very convenient and easy to find. It's also about 15 to 20 minutes stroll from Effiel Tower. Hotel staff are all very helpful, especially the night shift hotel staff who boiled hot water for us on the day we arrive. Definitely will stay here again if we go to Paris again. If I have to find something that can be improved, then maybe there should be a small fridge in the rooms so that we can keep our drinks. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: elisaED
Reviews.Content: Position: very good, about 10 minutes walk from the Tour Eiffel. The Metro station is very close to the hotel, right accross the street (you can hear it from the hotel because it's not under the ground, it can be a little annoying but if you don't have trouble sleeping you'll get used to it soon). Room: our room was tiny, the bathroom too... we stayed 4 days so it wasn't a big deal. There was a flat screen and free Wi-Fi (very useful!), in the room there is everything you need if you don't have particular needs. The room was clean. Staff: some of them were not so friendly, they could be nicer but it was ok. Considering the average hotels in Paris I think this is a good hotel comparing the price and the position, there also are a lot of services in the area (restaurants, market, bakeries...). I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “That's a great place!”
Reviews.Author: deejayalien
Reviews.Content: I can only say good things about this hotel,cheap,good service,only nice and friendly people there,fast wifi...The only thing was wrong there ,that sometimes you can hear the metro i moving,but to sleep there...excellent!in 10 minutes we could see the eiffel tower.Shortly it is a perfect choice for normal people:)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, friendly staff, WIFI available”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer0705
Reviews.Content: This review is based on two Canadian travellers, myself and my boyfriend, who spent four wonderful and romantic nights in Paris in October 2010. We travel frequently and our minimum standards are at the very least those akin to Marriot hotel chains. First of all, this hotel is situated within a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and has a metro station pretty much right outside the door to take you anywhere in Paris. So the location is superb! Other reviews say a two stop metro ride from the Eiffel tower, but why would you bother when you can just walk there so easily? And the view walking/approaching the tower is just as spectacular as the tower itself. If you are arriving from the airport and choose to take the metro to this hotel destination, you have to switch metro cars twice to get there (airport to Gare du Nord to Opera to la Motte Piquet), which is a bit cumbersome with luggage, but you can always take a cab instead (which would likely run you $50 euros). There are great restaurants in the area and a huge selection of restaurants to choose from in this area that clearly cater to English speaking tourists, as we had no problems finding menus with engligh descriptions. Definitely eat at Carmine on the corner, a wonderful Italian restaurant with the best service we had in Paris (and that says a lot, as we found restaurant service in Paris is pretty terrible). There is also a place on the corner across from Carmine that serves GIGANTIC seafood platters. We arrived to the hotel early (around noon) and there were no problems with early check-in. The front desk staff were very accommodating and it was very appreciated after a long flight and some jet lag. Also, if you speak limited French, the staff can accommodate you in English. The first thing I noticed about the hotel itself is that it is older (as are most buildings in Paris!) but that it part of it's quaint charm. It does not subscribe to room key cards, rather they provide you a big clunky key to open your door (don't forget to drop the key off in the basket at the front desk when you leave the hotel for the day, a new process to us). The room size is average to small, I believe ours was a double as they call it. I think our room number was 216 so we were on the second floor, but they have a lift too if you don't want to walk a few flights of stairs after a long day. The room has beautiful french doors that act as the 'window' of the room and it was so beautiful outside that it was nice to leave them open to get the fresh air. The view itself was not overly spectacular (see photos) and next time I would choose a room with a bit of a better view. The bathroom is immaculate and made of marble. The toilet has an intense flush and is very powerful. The bathtub is extremely deep and long, but there are no shower doors or curtains which means a lot of water on the floor after showers (not for me so much as my boyfriend). Ladies: WHERE THE HECK IS THE HAIRDRYER? Oh, it's that 1950's antique looking device on the bathroom wall! It looks like a vaccum tube and is not overly powerful, so ladies, bring your own hair dryer (with applicable Europe plug device) if you want to avoid some bad hair days in Paris. It was a funny and enjoyable experience though - we were amused by the device. I don't think the hotel should change it because it enhances the fun and new experience of the hotel. The beds - not the worst, but definitely not the best. After four nights, my back was hurting a bit from sleeping in the bed. The pillows - terrible! These pillows were almost the worst ones I've slept on; hard as rocks and lumpy. My boyfriend somewhat agreed with this as well. He likes to sleep with numerous pillows and the hotel staff had no problems bringing extra pillows, so the staff was accommodating in that regard. The room service (ie: the cleaning) was always done on time and the room was kept very clean throughout our stay. Bear in mind, the hotel prohibits you from bringing food into the hotel rooms (although we did eat "take away" crepes in our hotel one night but I'm sure the hotel would frown upon this given that their notice advises you not to eat in the hotel rooms. I can't speak to any fitness facilities or breakfast/eating areas, as we did not explore the hotel outside of the lobby and our own room. I believe we paid approximately $130-$140 Euros per night. At the end of our trip in Paris, we went to London via the Eurostar train. It cost us about $16 Euros for a cab ride to train station to catch our Eurostar train to London. Our cab driver cursed at the traffic in angry French and it was kind of hilarious! All in all, we would return and stay in this hotel again for future visits to Paris but I would likely ask for a room that had a better view. Enjoy your stay at the Hotel Tourisme!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value // Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: lwmueller
Reviews.Content: In a city like Paris, finding a decent hotel for under $200/night is next to impossible -- let alone one that's well-situated. Tourisme is both. Myself and my fiance LOVED this place. It's pretty basic, nothing luxurious about it, but it's very clean and comfortable and Motte-Picquet is such a great little avenue. You've got five or six excellent brasseries and restaurants right outside your door, in addition to a great pastry shop next door and a cheap market a block away. Tourisme is no more than a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Musee Rodin, and there's a metro stop right outside the front door. We were on the 4th floor and I was able to hear the train down below a few times. Nothing that bothered me and I'm a light sleeper, but closer to ground level, it may be louder. The hotel was renovating when we were there, so the phone in the room was out of order, but the front desk was up front about this and it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for easy access to all of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CycloneIowa
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Paris and we wanted a place that was clean and secure with easy access to see the sights. We were not disappointed. The hotel was a short walk away from the Eiffel Tower or just two train stops away. We were able to connect anywhere we wanted to go with the metro station that was across the street. There were a few restaurants nearby and a bakery. For those that needed a bit of America there was a McDonalds down the street. The hotel felt very safe. Our room was clean, a bit cramped, but it was comfortable. We had a late train to catch and so on the day that we checked out they even held onto our bags for us so we could see some more sites and then come back for all of our luggage. For the money it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: chuckster2
Reviews.Content: The Tourisme Hotel is a great value in an excellent location. The staff was very helpful and happily accommodated our late morning arrival. This made us feel most welcome since we had just flown in from the USA. The room was spotless, up to date, and very comfortable. The Metro is right out the front door and the Eiffel Tower is just a ten minute walk. In addition, several outdoor cafes are within a one minute walk of the hotel as well grocery stores and restaurants (and yes, even a McDonalds). The Tourisme is my hotel of choice in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm...”
Reviews.Author: Grin X
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Brilliant connectivity. It's right opposite the La Motte-Picquet metro station, and has the number 80 bus coming bang outside the hotel. However, the hotel is not two MINUTES from the Eiffel Tower; it's two STATIONS away. So it's not as close as I thought. Further, I understand that the hotel was under renovation when we stayed, but the service could have been more satisfying. There was no Internet terminal, and the breakfast was very, very, very bare. Only bread and juice; nothing else. The rooms were small. I know this was Paris in peak season, and we couldn't get anything better for our budget, but spacious rooms can be fuel to the mind during a hectic trip. However, the lady at the reception (short, boycut hair) was very nice and was huge help with the tours and bookings, and I really appreciate that. Hotels need to realise the importance of having an Internet terminal in this day and age, when it is the oxygen for traveling. It is impossible to look up information without it about tours, buses, etc and makes things really easy. I don't think a TV is half as necessary in the room as an Internet terminal is at the reception. And wifi is not enough because chugging a laptop along on a trip is not possible for everyone who wants to travel light. The hotel is a sincere place: efforts are being made, but they certainly have a long, long way to go. Making a judgement at this stage would also be slightly unfair since they were under renovation, but wish it had been better. Check whether the renovation is over before you book this hotel. All in all, helpful, cooperative staff who kept our luggage, etc, quite nicely for the entire day, and provided good tips and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RosaOrta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located near the Eiffel tower and Champ-de-mars. The room was spacious, clean and adequate with good facilities. The bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and eager to help you. I liked the hotel, it's really convenient to walk around. And it's very good value for money. That's all. Stay again if I go back Paris.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: fushia288
Reviews.Content: this is not a fancy hotel, but it is convenient to get to from the airport by Rossi bus and metro stop. The room is large enough, clean with a large bathroom. It is close to walk to the Eiffel Tower, and the wonderful Cler Road where there is great food market and traditional food shops. Went with my 20 year old daughter, and would return. Very good value. Try to get a room in the back as in the front I think it would be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to have found this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFans99
Reviews.Content: My family spend 4 nights here in July. We easily found the hotel after traveling from the Train Station via the Metro. We had a quad room and were amazed at the size of the room and bathroom as well. Very clean place. Note that it is still undergoing remodeling, but we were never disturbed by this. You also will notice/feel the pasing trains but it is not a deal breaker unless you are a very very very light sleeper. This place is a 10 min walk to the Eiffel Tower. It also has plenty of cafes, bakeries, and small grocery stores on the same street. I'm glad I found it. It made my visit comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, average service. But...bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: rplj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tourisme for 1 week in may 2009. Good value for the money, with adequate rooms, and very good location, 800m far from Champ du Mars and above the La Motte-Picquet metro station (which serves lines 6, 8 and 10). The staff was most of times kind and helpful. But, there was a serious inconvenience which prevents me from recommending this otherwise good budget hotel: we had several bedbug bites in our last night. Hardly a nice goodbye to Paris and Europe.

Reviews.Title: “More than what i expected!”
Reviews.Author: cbf2897
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel being only two stars - it has everything that we could have wanted. Its location was superb, with a nice little cafe beside it; Macdonalds and Printemps supermarket opposite it. And not to mention the nice weekend market underneath the subway tracks. The subway entrance is just a few steps away and you could walk to the Eiffel Tower and there are nice little restaurants enroute! For those avid shoppers, there is a H&M and Pimkie for the missus just round the corner. The room has good facilities (i stayed in a superior double), is clean and huge! Comfortable bed with a nice LCD TV. From the window, i could look out at night and just see people passing by. I will be returning to this hotel again during a short stopover in Paris in Sep. No doubt, it certainly surpassed my expectation!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: ArtLover4545
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from trip to Paris and had the good fortune of staying at the Tourisme Hotel. The location is phenomenal; it is right on top of the Motte-Piquet metro stop, which conveniently has three different metro lines that intersect. Getting around was made easy. The rooms were standard european small, but completely mangeable and clean. If I only had one complaint, it was that they boast the use of a free computer in the lobby, but because the hotel is under construction it was not in use. We did have to walk to an internet cafe, and I did think they should have provided monetary assistance in some way. Other than that, the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Luciana O
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in July 2010 and have already started recommending this great value hotel. Our room (105) was perfect for our needs: spacious, clean, newly renovated (and private) bathroom, air conditioning, Internet and plasma TV. The location is very closed to the Eiffel Tower and on the corner you have several subway lines which take you everywhere in less than 15 minutes. The staff was extremely helpful and bilingual. Overall, and excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great For Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Macxbebe
Reviews.Content: Since Paris was our last stop of our French honeymoon, my wife and I were a bit exhausted from the 6 hour train ride from Nice. As we finally came out of the station near the hotel, it was fairly easy to spot the hotel in a clean and cozy neighborhood surrounded by retail stores, coffee shops, groceries, and restaurants. We had a problem with the booked room due to ongoing renovation works in the hotel, but were promptly addressed by the staff and transferred us to a bit smaller room, but cheaper nonetheless. Room was always clean whenever we came back, and staff was very helpful in providing information to tourists. Except for the occasional rumbling of the Metro that you could feel in your room, the hotel is very nice. Get the upper floor rooms to avoid disturbance from the Metro if you are a light sleeper. If we plan another Paris trip, this hotel is on the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in the heart of Paris, a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: kimetraveler
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. Boy, were you guys right on. The hotel was wonderful. This lovely hotel is in the heart of Paris near the Eiffel Tower. Right outside your door is the Metro which can whisk you away to all the sites of Paris. Some of the reviewers complained of noise from the Metro, but I did not find that to be a problem. I did feel the rumble of the Metro at times, but not a problem. The rooms were small but cozy and very comfortable. The staff spoke English and made me feel right at home. They made dinner reservations for me, called a cab for me and answered all my questions. I felt that the price was very good for this comfortable hotel, close to everything. I would definitely stay here if I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money for Paris is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: Rach_Aussie
Reviews.Content: The room and decor is very dated but in fantastic condition and very clean. Its actually quite cute. I would stay here again no question. Oh also I booked the superior double room, thought why not it was only an extra ten euros. The room was very spacious and would be very comfortable for a lengthy stay. (We stayed for two nights) It also had a cute open up balconette style window which I loved. The value for money for Paris is unbeatable. A 5-10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Lots of lovely brasseries near by, a bakery next door (one member of staff not friendly pretended not to speak english although clearly did, rest were ok though) food is nice from the bakery though which is the most important thing! There is also a weekend market a 1 minute walk away which was fabulous. Yes the hotel is right on top of a train station, we were on the third floor I couldn't feel it and didnt really hear it. We were tired from sightseeing all day anyway. Staff were very friendly and helpful when booking tours and all spoke english which made it easier for us! Also our train out on our last day didn't leave till late and although we had checked out the staff held our bags for us which was very much appreciated as we didnt have to carry them around all day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with Tourisme Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fernando_brazil_13
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews in tripadvisor I selected the Tourisme Hotel for my one week stay in Paris in early May. The hotel is very well located and since I was traveling alone I was very pleasantly surprised to see the size and quality of my room. The room was quite big for european standards and very nice. I think it was refurbished recently, because everything looked brand new and I even had a big LCD TV with cable(most channels in French though...). The neighborhood is very nice, with two patisseries, a Mac Donalds and a very useful minimarket called MONOPRIX nearby. Subway access is also great and it took me everywhere I wanted in Paris. The lift wasn't working, but after having carried my heavy lugagge through plenty of subway stations without escalators in Paris, I didn´t really care to that. The room shakes a bit when the subway passes underneath, but it didn't bother me either. I was just too tired every night and this noise almost disappears after midnight. The bed was big, confortable and the room was very clean. I especially liked all the space available. If I come back to Paris one day, I will probably stay there again. The staff was nice and I was happy they would speak English, since I had a hard time in Paris for not being able to speak French. Both check in and check out were extremely fast and easy. I was very happy with my stay there and can certainly reccomend the Tourisme Hotel for people visiting Paris. The only thing I missed in my room was a mini-fridge. That would have made the stay there perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: carolm32
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast for 6 euros is a better deal than most of the surrounding cafes offer and the breakfast room is comfortable, bright and cheery. Don't expect an American breakfast - in France you get coffee and bread, juice if you're lucky. You're supposed to eat your big meal at lunchtime. The elevator, when it's working, is the biggest I've seen in Europe. The trouble is, it doesn't always work. The only complaint I would have is the metro noise at night, which is not the hotel's fault. Staff speak English and are very helpful. Hotel has WiFi but no public computer and the nearest Internet service is about 6 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to this hotel, still a great find, very cheap, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: cumbrian_08
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. we stayed here last april and decided to stay again due to the great location and the price. The hotel is located right next to the metro station "la motte picquet - grenelle" which serves a number of different lines which makes it very easy to visit the tourist attractions. the hotel is only a 10 minute walk away from the eiffel tour and champ du mars which is a lovely way to walk up to the eiffel. the hotel is very clean, breakfast is cheap at 6euros and the service is great. free wifi available but you need your own laptop. rooms are basic but clean and have a large lcd television with many different languages including sky news and bbc world news. most rooms have a free safe, ours didnt this time but we werent that fussed. lots of shops, restaurants, bars and cafes in the area including a monoprix and mcdonalds across the road. the hotel doesnt serve any food other than a continental breakfast but they sell drinks including water, coffee, cappucino, beer and orange for 2euros which is very cheap by paris standards. paris is a lovely city but VERY expensive no matter where you stay. i wouldnt exactly say this hotel is in a touristy area its more the suburbs but the restaraunts are still pretty expensive your looking at 12+euros for your main meal, 5+euros for a drink, and around 6+euros for a dessert. we paid 4.80 for a coffee next to the eiffel!! i would deffinately stay at this hotel again, theyve just fitted a brand new lift which is much bigger than the old one and great for luggage as the stairs and quite narrow and windy. the hotel has a lovely old parisian feel and yes it may be a little shabby in places but you need to take in the charm and features such as stained glass windows.

Reviews.Title: “Misfortune”
Reviews.Author: Viajante_Mundo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Tourisme Hotel in our trip to Paris in April 2010. We had only one problem. A couple of days before we leave our country to start the trip, I received an email from the hotel saying that the lift wouldn’t be working and if it would be a problem for us. I answered them that since they had someone to help with the luggage, it wouldn’t be a problem at all. They sent me a reply telling that it was going to be someone there to take care of the luggage and I appreciated very much their attention. But once we got the, exhausted from a very long flight, there was no one to help. The woman at reception told us she could not leave the reception because she was alone and if we want some help, we should wait for her colleague to arrive. I was really upset about my husband climbing the stairs to get all our suitcases to the third floor. I left one behind and a man took it to the room for us, not very pleased. I ask at the reception to arrange someone to carry the luggage on the day we were living but then they asked one of the housemaids to help. I was very upset again. The woman was not strong enough to carry all the suitcase and my husband had to take it down. The hotel is very good. Excellent location, the room we were in had a good size, was very clean and good value for money. But I found it extremely disrespectful how they managed the situation of the luggage for us and even for the employees who were asked to do something that they were not hired for. I could stay there again if I was completely sure that the lift would work properly.

Reviews.Title: “Lift was broken”
Reviews.Author: smd3onthego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tourisme hotel in Paris for two nights in late March. The hotel was easy to find since it is across the street from the train/metro. The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. The hotel is three or four metro stops from everything you want to see. Yet it still seems to be far removed from the city. I was hoping to have at least a glimpse of the eiffel tower, but no. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel is the lift was broken. But the lady at the desk said they are putting in a new one which should be working by June. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice except for the undefined shower. The whole room was tiled, therefore it was shower. So everything got wet. Not in a quiet part of the city. It was a good hotel for the money. Lots of restaurants nearby. Didn't have the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighboor Hood and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kcalmole
Reviews.Content: Typical small paris hotel room, they all are unless you go into the megabucks luxury catagory. Well laid out though, kind of like a cruise ship cabin, plenty of space for luggage. Shower floor is a separate space at one end from rest of bathroom but it does not have a lip or rise to it or a door so water can flow out. However, we just kept shower aimed towards the wall and everything drained fine with never a wet bath floor. With hubby at 6' 8" we were happy for a TALL shower. Good hot water and water pressure too. The room was clean with very nice linens and a decent bed. Any American traveling in Europe just has to understand they do NOT have large hotel rooms like we do in US. Know this ahead you will be much happier wherever you stay. Location is great as all others have said. Easiest on/off metro imaginable plus walked many places including great food shopping area of Rue Cler. Small grocery across street is VERY valuable for water and snacks and Mc'Donalds came in handy too. ATM machine within two blocks also. Although we could hear the trains, the metro did not phase us at all, we spent such full days we were too tired to be bothered by the noise at night. No different then where we have stayed in NY city. Desk staff spoke English well enough for our needs and certainly MUCH better than my French. I appreciate the efforts of those in Europe to accomodate those of us who do not speak their language. All in all a great value for Paris which is SOOOOOO expensive. In our touring of the city I saw other hotels I had considered and left being very happy with our choice of the Tourisme Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful but exactly what you need”
Reviews.Author: WakeyTilly
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for 5* luxury, this hotel isn't for you. If you're looking for a basic, reasonably-priced hotel in a great area, this is where you want to stay. We'd rather spend money on the holiday than the hotel, so when we saw the price and the location of this hotel we decided to give it a try. When we got to the hotel we were pleasantly surprised with the room, and by the end of the holiday we were very pleased we had picked this hotel. Other reviews we read before we went complained about the noise from the metro. We were aware when trains went past, however were not disturbed by them. We would rather have the convenience of three metro lines on our doorstep, which will take you to pretty much anywhere in Paris with at most one change (including the airports, didn't bother with a taxi), than the occasional rumble. Another fab feature of this hotel is the free Wifi, which we used to investigate what we were planning to do the next day, check flight times etc. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the immediate area, and if you turn right out of the hotel and go straight over the crossroads, there's a lovely little street with shops and restaurants that unfortunately we didn't discover until late one evening when most were closed. Left for a couple of minutes takes you to the Parc du Champs de Mars, which you then walk straight through to the Eiffel Tower. Unless we win the lottery in the meantime, we plan to return to this hotel next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location--and the smell of fresh baked bread”
Reviews.Author: ktrgmalloy
Reviews.Content: I loved that this was so close to the Train station, next door to a bakery, and next to a weekend market. It was also fairly close to the Eiffel Tower. We didn't have any problem sleeping...but that could have been jet lag kicking in. The room was on the smaller side for American standards but I think just fine for a room in Paris. The shower and toilet were separate, but both in our room. Overall a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at this rate”
Reviews.Author: the_goce
Reviews.Content: We've been at this hotel for 8 nights and we really enjoyed the stay.The room was really clean and quite large . Yes, you can feel the metro passing by but not to such extent that bothered us (we stayed at the second floor). We used the room as a base camp leaving at 8 AM in the morning and returning back for a shower and a sleep late in the evening. In this purpose it was as good as intended . Maybe we were to tired to feel disturbed by the metro . We found a Carrefour supermarket that is opened up to 23:45 -except sunday - at 10 minutes stroll from Tour Eifel (L'Ecole Militaire metro station). We found this very usefull as we repeatedly returned back late in the evening . Free WiFi internet acces was also a large plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “24 hour train noise, shaking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ho-li-Daaaaaay
Reviews.Content: +ve: 10 min walk to eiffel tower and hotel is outside the tube station -ve: Trains every few minutes casuing massive room vibrationsall night! basic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in an expensive city..”
Reviews.Author: Amy1204
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tourisme Hotel and paid 82 Euro per night which is good value for Paris! The hotel was nothing flash but it was comfortable, clean and in a good location. It was 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel tower and the metro was just across the street which made it easy to get around. The staff weren't overly friendly but they were helpful when asked for information. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone not looking to blow the budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Terra_Gallorum
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every may for 2 weeks because the location is perfect near the city centre, with a metro station outside serving 3 different lines. There are many cafes and restaurants as well a quick taken away foods in the neighbourhood. To the right as you exit the hotel and pass under the elevated metro line you come to rue Commercial with many different small shops over a section several blocks long. I don't live in my hotel when I travel. This hotel is clean. A place to leave your things, get a shower, sleep, use the internet with your lap top though they could start encluding this in the price or for a small supplement to have 24 hour wifi. More small hotels are beginning to do this in Paris now. I've been staying here for several years and like the familiarity with the neighbourhood I have acquired. There are newer hotels or more luxurious but I don't see the point of spending a huge amount of money for a place to wash up and sleep and to leave your clothes. I save my money for the other things I want to do in Paris like eating and touring and all the other things Paris offers. For some the great hotel is part of the vacation and I understand that so this hotel is not for you but I really like it and the price is certainly right considering you are in Europe and 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, I think....runied by lack of sleep.”
Reviews.Author: paulstevens_uk
Reviews.Content: I’m usually a little cynical in my posts on trip-advisor; and whilst I have only done a few they can be either critically negative or immensely supportive. With the Touriseme Hotel I’m a touch confused and will thus keep this brief and allow you to read all the other much more informed reviewers. On entry for a 2* its good, well maintained, and on arrival pleasant – the lift others review I didn’t use, being young (40!) and healthy I can still manage the stairs – albeit it sober. The room again is pleasant and welcoming and covers clean and TV modern. All good then….until you live it for a night (remembering this is potentially a “thing at the time” rather than always). Maybe I’m wrong, but the delights of the metro waking you in a rubbly-place-falling-down-romantic-way, pipes banging, radiators dripping (though internally), people in the street shouting, neighbours frolicking and cold cappuccino on awakening – aren’t usually on my list of requirements for an hotel. The builders turning up at 8:00 and adding to the crescendo of wall upon mallet just adds that little extra to the romance of the Paris. We moved rooms first thing. Unfortunately room 210 didn’t help. Although bigger and better bathroom the “noise elements” pervaded. The hotel needs an update – no argument, some wall insulation for those romantics of us, some stability in the infrastructure of the building (if of course possible), some rectification of heating and moreover some ‘compensation’ or in fact closing for the period of the obvious renovation. I did raise with the management and again the day I left and negotiated a 40e discount – and having spent 4 sleepless nights gave in on arguing for more. Make your minds up from the reviews…..failing this….there is always the welcoming and peaceful catacombs!

Reviews.Title: “More than enough, with great location”
Reviews.Author: Waleed_Essam
Reviews.Content: You seriously won't need anything more than this hotel in Paris! great location, 10-15 min walk from Tour Eiffel. Right in front of Metro station which has 3 or 4 lines going through it. Area safe for night walks. For the metro noise, well, you can hardly feel it. I was in 4th floor and never felt it, a friend was on the 2nd floor and we felt it lightly when in his room. And all in all, when you are in Paris, you will probably be taking the last train back home as you wont be staying much in the hotel The hotel itself is very clean, the front desk people are so helpful and nice, I even wanted to empty my camera's memory card to my portable hard disk and they lent me their own computer to do so. Never had any meal there so can't judge the food, but my friend was happy with the breakfast. Rooms are not so wide but they are good with Paris standards. One downside is the size of the elevator, can only fit one person with luggage or 2, for a group you'll be going up to your rooms on 3 or 4 stages. Great value for money, and the perfect place to explore Paris on foot or by metro/train. I'm getting married soon and I'm planning to take my wife there on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing compares”
Reviews.Author: crab67tkf
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Tourisme in Paris after coming over by Eurostar from London. There was a big line at the station for taxis but we only waited 15 mins tops. The hotel was literally 2 minutes walk from the first view of the Eiffel Tower and then a straight walk to the bottom of it. Walking this area at any time felt safe. The rooms were oustanding and the kids were on a different floor to us but being teenagers this pleased them. There is a Monoprix to the right with clothing on the ground floor and a little supermarket at the top which sells hot food as well as normal supermarket food. Mc Donalds is on the opposite corner and the RER and underground is a stones throw away. There was a little market on the street in front of the Monoprix on Sunday which sold hot food, fresh fruit and vegies, lollies etc. Turning right out of the hotel and walking 50m we had our breakfast each morning at Cafe Grenelle consisting of a cafe creme (coffee with milk) and a croisant. For 4 of these it was 22 Euro which is $34 Aust Dollars ($8.50 per serve) which was the norm for our entire stay. Turning right at this cafe and walking another 50m was Sandwich Grec which sold the best pizzas and kebabs. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful and ordered our taxi for us the night before we left as taxi drivers don't like families of 4 with 4 pieces of luggage and 4 pieces of hand luggage. We were turned away at the station and had to wait for a mini van looking taxi to roll up. So pre-booking and letting the company know how many and how much luggage cost a little booking fee but gave us piece of mind as we had a train booked and couldn't be late. Thanks Tourisme. p.s it cost us over $400 AUD to go to Euro Disney and spent hours lining up for 2 rides and nearly another hour for something to eat - a real waste of time sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Rooms just ok.”
Reviews.Author: Y-Roc78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tourisme Hotel for 3 nights in September 09. There are two very good things about this hotel. 1 is the location -- very close to the subway, plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby, and a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. 2 is the value for the money -- you get a decent sized room, moderately clean and free wifi. What I didn't like is that the room was very outdated and in bad need of renovation, there was construction on the outside of the building...the view from my window was of a scaffolding and occasionally a worker or two on it, and we had to leave our key at the front desk when we left and they didn't ask for ID when we retrieved the key, we just had to say our room #, which made me a little uncomfortable. Overall, it was decent value for the money, particularly in Paris. And of the course, the location was hard to beat, although, I'm undecided if I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well located, friendly english speaking management”
Reviews.Author: Jemnelson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty much all you need for a reasonably priced place to stay in Paris. Its very conveniently located next to the Metro, has a McDonalds and plenty of restaurants and brasseries within a stone's throw and is only ten minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and the sight seeing river boats. The friendly manager (also owner?) Al (Alain) is an American of French family origin so if your French is not up to scratch its no problem. We had room 101 with a very large and comfortable double bed plus two proper comfortable fold down single beds for the kids (11 and 9). There was a free to use safe and free Wi-Fi, which is pretty rare these days. We connected a laptop and iPod touch using different security codes supplied by the hotel. The room was well decorated with a large and very clean bathroom (bath, toilet and shower). This room faces onto the Avenue so could be noisy at certain times of the day I guess although being there over New Year there was little traffic to disturb us. There is a rumble from the Metro trains but this is was not much of a problem. I cannot vouch for the decoration / size of the other rooms but by Parisian standards room 101 was spacious and above average. Breakfast (six euros per person) is available in the small salon next to reception. There is the usual croissant / baguette / butter & jam / tea / coffee / orange juice on offer. It was plentiful, good quality and good value by Paris standards. Would I recommend this hotel and stay there again? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccability on a Shoestring Budget”
Reviews.Author: JamieInTransit
Reviews.Content: Tourisme Hotel is a traveler's delight. It's well priced and yet it's as charming, and it's location is as good, as any other 5* hotel in Paris. It really does tick every box and I can't recommend it highly enough. Our stay: Stayed in a Triple Room for 3 nights in July 2009. Our journey there: We had a fairly tumultuous start to our travels in Paris, literally speaking. We'd foolishly assumed that since there was a metro station on the doorstep of the hotel that we could navigate our way there from Gare de Lyons. Don't make this mistake too! It turned out to be a logistical nightmare. We had to lug suitcases (weighing 30kg+) around for nearly an hour -- walking to another station and then carrying them up and down countless flights of stairs (which resulted in a nasty tumble done one flight). Moral of the story: if you're traveling with luggage from GDL, take a cab. Service: (+) Staff were very friendly. (+) Desk clerks all spoke fluent English. (+) We got free wifi in our room (just had to ask politely for it at the desk). (+) Staff kept our bags after we checked out and before we left for the airport. (-) One cleaner didn't speak English and kept coming back to our room when we'd said we didn't want it cleaned. Location: (+) Eiffel Tower a 5 minute walk down the street from the hotel. You just need to print a google map and you're good to go. (+) You can take the subway almost EVERYWHERE else you want to go in Paris. (+) Metro station right outside the hotel. Some reviewers complained about the noise from the trains. The noise was audible to us but it wasn't so bad that it kept us from sleeping. If anything, I was glad some of the noise lifted from the subway because it's really such a minor issue and I think it might have been one of the reasons the rooms were so cheap. (+) Plenty of side streets with reasonably priced cafes and shops. (+) Maccas across the street (presumably open 24hr). (+) On Sunday mornings there are markets held just on the corner of the hotel. You can pick up some freshly-cooked breakfast, souvenirs (at half the price that you'll find most other places) and even some knock-off designer gear. You must spent an hour walking through the markets. Room: (+) The room was clean and seemed as though it had been renovated recently. Windows opened out onto quasi-terrace. We were also lucky enough to be on the 3rd floor right at the end of the hall (facing the metro). So we had access to the spare toilet and the window looking out onto the street. Hotel Facilities: (-) There was a narrow elevator behind the reception desk. It was broken for 2 days that we were there although it seemed like an irregularity. (+) The carpet stair leading up to our room were adorable. Some were wonky and awkwardly narrow in some spaces but we found that really quaint. (+) No swipe key. You'll just get a bulky key that you leave at reception when you exit the hotel. If you're traveling to Paris to see Paris, then you should stay at Tourisme Hotel. Really, what's the point of traveling to Paris and staying at the Ritz if you're going to be locked up in your room the whole time?

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel. Well situated for central Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Rockfiend
