Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days. The staff were helpful(reasonably) the room was clean and changed daily. Very well situated and easy to find, right next to metro station. Couldn't fault it for the money. It should be noted however, that they are doing some building work during the day. This shouldnt be a problem for most people as they would be out during the day as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: rivrics
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tourisme Hotel for 3 nights. I must say that the Hotel location is excellent. It is a stone throw away from the La Motte Picquet Grenelle metro station with many restaurants nearby. It is also within walking distance away from the beautiful Eiffel Tower. Other than that, there is nothing to shout about for this hotel. The hotel condition is average with a weird smell which is particularly strong along the second floor lobby where we stayed. It has an old-school lift which I find it somewhat interesting (yes the lift is working). The hotel room is nicely sized. However, I found the bed uncomfortable and it is certainly due for a change, in my opinion. The mattress is old and instead of a flat surface like any other bed, the center of the mattress has sunken in which is really unfortunate especially if you are sharing the bed with someone else as both of you would tend to slide down to the center and knock onto each other. The hotel is not cheap but it is probably due to the location. If I were to visit Paris again, I would not want to stay in the same hotel again as I believe there should be better value hotel else where in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnh
Reviews.Content: Agree with all recent reviews. Location is fantastic - close to metro, Eiffel Tower, lots of restaurants. The price was good for Paris (89e including breakfast), the room was small but clean. Breakfast was typically french (juice, coffee, croissants, baguettes) which was more than enough to keep us going for the day. Staff were pleasant and spoke English which was helpful with our limited French. Computer and internet access is available for a modest fee.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it says it is - but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: Schwolop
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly adequate hotel, offerring a great location, competent bilingual (French/English at least, some staff speak German or Spanish too, perhaps more) staff, and pretty good value. When I say good value, bear in mind this is Paris, so if you're a budget traveller touring Europe this will still be the most expensive hotel you stay in, and a huge disappointment if you think of it like that - consider the prices of every other hotel in Paris in Tourisme starts to look like a pretty good option! I can't fault the hotel for any of its advertised features. It does have a lift, breakfast is available (although we didn't try it - crepes, baguettes, and croissants are readily available just outside or easy walking distances away), and the rooms are serviced each day. There is a safe in each room (at least "deluxe" one we stayed in), and it is literally 10m from the metro station. So, there are no negatives, but for us, there were no positives either. We were disappointed to find there was no kettle or cups to make hot drinks, and no fridge to store food or drinks in. We can't really complain about this however, as they don't try to claim they have these features. In short, this hotel is everything it says it is, but nothing more. If you're happy with that, it provides perfectly adequate and reasonable value accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Maprill
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week in July 2009. +: *great location (metro station Motte Piquet Grenelle just outside the hotel, 5 min walks to Chmps de Mars and 7 min to Eifel Tower; MONOPRIX supermarket across the road, a couple of longer working small grocery shops on the street and a good commercial street with lots of shops near the hotel); *AC that was good working and cood be regulated in the room (it helped a lot as it was almost +30 outside); *quite a cosy room with a various storage (we were three adults and though the room itself is pretty small, we could keep our things all in order); *good noise isolation - good windows (though we had a room that faced a calm street so maybe a bit noisier if facing the main street) *room was clean and renovated "-": towels were not always changed even if they were wet, just neatly piled; but when we asked for a change it was done immedialtely. All in all - great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sstroll
Reviews.Content: Close to metro. Internet access. clean and affordable for business/leisure travel

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean and comfortable, unbeatable value”
Reviews.Author: sunvalley102
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Tourisme Hotel in late October 2009 for one night before heading on to Lyon the next day. We were recently in Paris for 10 days in June this year and stayed in Pt Maillot area but the location of Tourisme Hotel is brilliant. As others have mentioned the hotel is very conveniently located close to the metro station and an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. The room for 3 was good, beds comfortable and the hotel staff helpful. Very reasonable price of 102 euro for 3 of us for the night....wish we stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fireheadCarolina
Reviews.Content: Great location - We walked to the Eiffel Tower every day - The metro station is right there - On Sunday there was on open market set up under the metro rails - On our last night our daughter and grandson stayed with us and there was plenty of room - After spending a few days in Jarnac we came back to the Tourisme for our last night in Paris - I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good value with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great price, helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: melodeebeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June of this year and were very, very pleased. The staff was friendly and helpful and everyone we dealt with spoke English. The room was clean and just right for two people. It was VERY well-priced, not at all expensive. The hotel was at the intersection of two main roads with a Metro stop directly in front of the hotel, one across the street and one kitty-corner. There were a number of very good Brasseries (cafes) next door, across the street, and within a couple of minute walk. There was also a grocery mart across the street, as well as a pharmacy. The Eiffel Tower and River Seine was about a 5-10 minute walk. Actually, the park grounds (where there are great photo ops) was about 5 minutes and then another 5 minutes or so to walk through the park to the tower. Directly behind the tower, down by the river is the Batobus, the water taxi that takes you to all the main sites along the Seine. I guess I'd have to say the location was what we liked best and since I really should find something negative to say . . . the elevator was VERY small. You can fit two people and two suitcases. We generally used the stairs. If that's the only negative thing I have to say about it, though, I'd have to say that's pretty minor (at least for us).

Reviews.Title: “A real good ..Quality Hotel you can bank on”
Reviews.Author: Nirupama
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern, well maintained, well equipped hotel with courteous English speaking reception staff. Fresh bright room, lift, good bathroom, fresh towels everyday, very comfy bed & nice French windows. Air-con works very well (no noise, nothing jaded) Hotel is located in a modern locality (exceptionally decent, nothing shady nearby). Infact one exit from the La Motte Picquet Metro directly opens in front of the hotel entrance. Nothing can be more convenient. You can save valuable time & money by staying here. MacDs diagonally across the road so you can have breakfast/dinner at the cheapest of prices{since every other food option in Paris is quite exps}. There is a pastry shop next to the Hotel & a nice sit-out café next to it. After reseaching hotels for over a year I found Tourisme (& cancelled my booking with another hotel @Euro140/day with AC ...similar features like Tourisme but in an old bldg. I just thought why pay more & compromise on the condition of the hotel) We stayed for 3 nights at Tourisme & since the hotel was booked we got the Euro77 room – but I have no complains. In all of Europe SMALL is not a factor that u can consider. It is cleanliness/comfy bed/AC/shower/ventilation/reception/value for money that matters. Tourisme has it all & unlike other hotels does not rip you off with its tariff. We were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: PDvac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Tourisme and found it to be clean and a good value in an expensive city. The room is somewhat small but the only time we were there is when we went to sleep. No frills. Kind helpful staff. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel very close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: daisyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable, clean and close to the Eiffel Tower. We were very surprised for the price. We would do all the touristy things during the day and went back to the hotel for a quick nap before heading back out for the rest of the day. It's great that the hotel was next to a metro station. I would highly recommend this hotel to others any day!

Reviews.Title: “great location and spacious triple room”
Reviews.Author: atlantajava
Reviews.Content: All the good things that previous reviewers have said about Tourisme are true. I would just highlight/add a few things: 1) the location is unbeatable - right next to the metro station, a McDonald's, and a Monoprix supermarket/department store, and 5 minutes from the Eiffel tower square. 2) our triple room is spacious with a queen and a single bed. The bath room is completely renovated with brand new tiles and fixtures. The room is air-conditioned. 3) the front desk staff speaks fluent English and is super helpful.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, CONVIENENT, COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: HtownAttorney
Reviews.Content: Of the 3 hotels we stayed at in Europe, I loved this one the MOST. It was VERY clean. The room was made and linens changed every day. The bathroom was spotlessand neat, although little small (common for Paris). The hotel is located on a major street with a subway station, taxis stand, and bus stops in front of hotel!!! Subway was the easiest way to travel in Paris. There are plenty of cafes, laundry and grocery stores within a block or two of hotel. Great shopping and boutiques down the street, and the best of ALL, the Eiffel Tower is within walking distance (4 blocks) The area is VERY safe and felt comfortable walking around late at night. Beds are decent. Matress pad thick for Europe standard (4-6 inches) A/C very cold!! Day Front desk ladies VERY helpful. However, night clerks VERY UNHELPFUL!!! night clerks seemed very bothered by questions or request of help. They just wanted to sit and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in Paris for budget tour”
Reviews.Author: InvisibleMo
Reviews.Content: Pros 1. Perfect location - Just next to the metro exit, Lots of restaurant, store within 5min walk. 2. Excellent reception - All staff may speak fluent english and provide helpful information 3. Room is large enough 4. Affordable price - 77 euros for 1 ensuit double room 1 night 5. Elevator/Lift is in service Cons 1. Toilet is too small 2. Breakfast is expensive

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: AZNativeTucson
Reviews.Content: An excellent value for Paris. Metro staion and a Monoprix (a French Target) litteraly seconds away by foot. The staff speaks English and are extremely accomodating and attentive. Hotel is surrounded by wonderful bistros and cafes. 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. We did hear the Metro but it was not a big deal. To get to the hotel from Charles deGaulle we took the RER. If you decide to take the RER be forewarned. Travel light. We had two bags and by the time we arrived in Paris proper the train was packed with locals who literally climbed over our bags and others to get in the car. We opted to take the Air France shuttle bus back to CDG. It was 15 euros each, cash only, no reservations. Got to the airport in about 40 minutes. Another thing. We tried to print our boarding passes at an internet cafe and were unable to do so. We were flying Delta. Stay here. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: valtripadv
Reviews.Content: My friends & I stayed at room 416 (triple sharing) at Tourisme Hotel for 6 nights. We booked our room via the hotel website for 102 euros/night, which I believed is very reasonable for a hotel in Paris especially for triple sharing which is not that much available. Tips: Booked the room via the hotel's website is cheaper than other alternatives and they are pretty fast! We loved the location! There are 3 metro lines which is very good as travelling to any part of Paris is a breeze. Attractions such as Eiffel tower, Hotel National les Invalides are all within a 10-15mins walking distance. We even walked to Champ Elysees from the hotel! There are a 2-3 supermarkets around the hotel, which we find it very useful to buy our bottled mineral water! There are also 3 chinese restaurants around the hotel, a Macdonald across the street, cafe, crepe shop, italian restaurant round the corner. There is even a market across the street every wednesday and sunday! The staff at Tourisme hotel can speak decent english and they are all very friendly and helpful. We arrived earlier than their check-in time and our room was ready. The staff even helped us to call our shuttle service to confirm our reservation. The hotel also has a small lift which can fit 1 person and a luggage, it is very useful if you have a 26" luggage with you! Our room had a double bed and a single bed, quite sufficient for 3 persons and three 26" luggage. The double bed is very good, clean & comfortable and the most important thing is you will not feel the bounce when anyone turn. The single bed however is a bit too soft. The room has an air-con installed which not common for hotels in Paris for a price of 102euros per night! Trust me, you will definitely need it for the months of April to September! The only minus point is the small bathroom which is a bit difficult to turn as you will hit the walls. The noise from the metro didn't really bother us as it is very soft and it stops at around 1am. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheFamilyPLAR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tourisme Hotel for four nights in early September, after having booked our room many months earlier via email. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was that we wanted a room that could comfortably sleep a family of four at a reasonable price (in Paris)...a more difficult find than one would think. The booking process went very smoothly and we got exactly what we ordered...actually, probably better than what we were expecting. The room (#101) had a double bed and a fold-out double-chair bed (ie. like a sofa bed but each side folded out separately)...all were very comfortable. Even with the kids' beds folded out and four suitcases opened up, there was still lots of space in the room...we're guessing that this room might've been two smaller rooms at some point in time. The ensuite washroom was also a good size. It was also great having the A/C. Although the continental breakfast was a little steep at 6 euros, we ate there anyway...it's just easier that way with kids. The food was good and the very friendly breakfast-lady helped us start our days off on the right foot. But the best thing of all about the hotel was its location. A 15-20 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, many stores/cafe's/restaurants up and down the street (we preferred the Franprix grocery store straight across the street), a large & FABULOUS Sunday morning farmers' market at the corner and three metro lines right outside our door. Perfect! Although some reviewers cite the noise factor coming from the metro trains, it wasn't an issue with us. Yes, we could definitely hear the rumbling of the trains from our 1st floor room (directly above the music store) but nothing to the extent that we couldn't sleep. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiansun1
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Paris. Stayed at Hotel Champ des Mars on my previous trip, but it was booked so I took a chance and tried Hotel Tourisme based on TripAdvisor recommendations. I would definitely return to this hotel. Clean. Good value. Comfortable beds. Our room was large (Paris standards) and the bathroom was not small (room 114). The staff at the front desk were always friendly and helpful. They would assist us with reservations and directions and they never made us feel that we were bothering them. Nice. Good location. Metro just right out the door. Good, fancier grocery store named Simply was around the corner and down by the church. Excellent bakery by the Simply store.

Reviews.Title: “Good lowish cost hotel in handy location”
Reviews.Author: NZ_Megan
Reviews.Content: Tourisme hotel was great for us, we didn't have a lot to spend but wanted somewhere comfortable and that is exactly what we got. We wanted to be near the Eifell Tower as we were doing some tours from there and the hotel is 15-20 mins walk away. There are plenty of food places nearby and good transport links. Not 5 star but they don't pretend to be - a really good 2 star hotel. Would stay again if in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: empty002
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this hotel. Part of me would have rather paid a bit more and had more amenities at a different hotel. The rooms are quite small and the bathroom is super small, so be aware of that. This is common in Paris. It was OK for me, but some people may not like this. Our room was clean, except the bathroom could have been a little better. One person a the desk was very nice, the other ignored us and didn't want to be bothered with answering any questions. We just asked about local places to eat. We were on the first floor, so you can hear the rummble of the metro. It runs until 12:30am, so this could really annoy some people. Ask to be on a higher floor if this may be an issue for you. At the same time, you are right at a metro stop, which is helpful. The Eiffel tower is about a 10-15 min walk, so we got to see that everyday, which was pretty wonderful. There are some great cafes on the street and we ate at a couple of them. The 15th arrondissements is pretty much just residential, so stay in the 7, 1, 8, or 4 to be a little more towards the action. There isn't much nightlife in the 15. I would also recommend one of the bus tours. You can really see a lot that you would miss if you only took the metro.

Reviews.Title: “All you could want -- at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: garza007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a dream. My wife and I were making our first trip to Paris, and we stayed at this hotel based on a value recommendation from Trip Advisor. The stay was wonderful. The room was always spotlessly clean and the location was terrific. We normally do not sleep well in hotel beds, but we both found this one to be extremely comfortable. The hotel was small but was very charming and well run. The front staff spoke great English and were very helpful in recommending local cafes. The location was perfect. It was only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler. The metro was extremely convenient with three lines crossing literally just across the street. With a carnet of metro cards, we were able to go anywhere in the city within only a few minutes. Having the Monoprix across the street was also very nice. We went several times to get waters, sodas, pastries, and even wine/cheese for our picnic. As an added benefit, there was an old-fashioned street market that sets up from 8-12pm on Sundays. It was wonderful to browse the wine, cheese, bread, fruits, and other delicacies. We skipped the hotel breakfast in favor of walking the neighborhood cafes each morning. All in all, the facilities were wonderful at a tremendous price of 77 euro per night. If we ever return, we will look no further than this hotel for our accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience on a budget”
Reviews.Author: srtram
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was clean and a good size, as was the bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we first got to our room it smelled of smoke (it's a non-smoking hotel). When I brought it to the attention of the staff member, he took it seriously. He gave me the key to another room to check to see if it was okay, and let us switch right away. As soon as we left the old room, the cleaning staff was in there trying to fix the problem. The staff helped out in other ways, too. The location next to the metro stop makes it easy to get anywhere in the city quickly. On the third floor we could hear the train slightly when it came by, but not enough to bother us. The Eiffel Tower is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Walk In Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: BCollyer
Reviews.Content: Could not find the hotel I wanted on this street so I walked in and asked to see a room. They said they could only show me the worst room in the hotel because the others were occupied. They showed me 305 which was perfectly fine. I ended up renting two rooms; 305 and 112. Both were clean, with AC, and comfortable. The location was excellent. At times when on the ground floor you could feel the subway...but you had to pay attention in order to feel it. This is a perfect clean base of which to explore the city. If you are in to fancy and are the type to fuss about anything then go elsewhere. If you are reasonable and simply want a quiet, clean, safe and great price then this is the hotel for you. Note: They charge for Wi Fi...but you can pick up someones unprotected Wi-FI from some rooms ; )

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: backpacker04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in July and really enjoyed our stay.Only five minutes from the eiffel tower and right next to the metro station.Lots of cafes nearby for good food and coffee.The monoprix across the street is very convenient for food for picnics.All in all a very good hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs for the jackhammers and metro”
Reviews.Author: MasterSkywalker
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits on top of the metro. The whole building shakes when a train comes by. Construction is also going on downstairs on the first floor for a retail store, where the hotel sits above. During the day, you're going to hear all the construction going on. We did not get a remodeled room. It's old and tiring. The only good thing about this place is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Most rooms are very nice as is the service.”
Reviews.Author: Trystelle
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Tourisme. It is in an excellent location. It is literally steps away from several different metro lines. There is also an open air market on Sunday and Wednesday next door. There are several very inexpensive groceries for supplies/picnics etc. It is a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. There are several adequate cafes in the immediate vicinity. If you stay here be sure to check the room they assign you. The same price rooms vary greatly in quality. The first room we were assigned was crude and uncomfortable. There was no shower curtain, mismatched linens and homemade bed tables. It was small even by Parisian standards. They were renovating the facade on the courtyard side of the building. There was staging directly outside of our window. It was very loud and the courtyard is an ugly alley type opening. We complained and were assigned a lovely little room at the front of the hotel. It was clean and cute, no smaller that one would expect in Paris. It seemed we were in a different hotel! Assuming you are given a decent room, this hotel is a remarkable value. With the exception of the overnight staff person, the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: AussiesinBrazil
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based solely on TA reviews and were not disappointed. Staff were friendly, helpful with directions, one even did some telephoning for us as we didn't speak french and were trying to contact relatives in Paris. We booked 2 triple rooms as we had 4 adults and 2 small children in our group. The rooms were exactly as I expected and everything worked fine. Beds are comfy and the slight rumbling of Metro beneath was not a problem for sleeping. Location is excellent -walking distance to Eiffel Tower and one step away from several Metro lines. Breakfast was substantial and served promptly, McDonalds is across the road for more options, but their coffee machine was broken for 3 out of our 6 day stay! Bathroom was small but plenty of shelf space for toiletries and the shower was excellent - plenty of hot water and lots of pressure. As a whole we loved our stay and would definitely recommend for families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lindabird16
Reviews.Content: The Tourisme Hotel is a great little two star hotel within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. It has all the basics at a good price and a convenient location. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. There is a Monoprix across the street. a bakery next store, and three subway lines can be accessed from in front of the hotel. The neighborhood is full of good restaurants with a variety of prices (our favorite was "Le Suffren" - great food at moderate prices). Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for good value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Convience at a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: jimdrw
Reviews.Content: Smack dab next to the La Motte Picquet Grenelle metro stop, this charming hotel is perfect as a sightseeing homebase. The station is a hub for 3 metro lines and makes quick hops very easy. The neighborhood is filled with cafes, shopping, patisseries, and locals. The Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler, and Ecole Miltaire are 5-10 min walk. It makes that evening romantic trek up the Eiffel Tower so easy when you can just stroll back through the park to your comfy air conditioned hotel. The Metro does make a bit of noise when it comes by, but is barely noticeable after a hard day of sightseeing. We had a triple room, which was enormous even for the States let alone Europe. The bathroom was very nice and the flat screen TV was a nice surprise. I would recommend staying away from the hotel breakfast. There are better options in the neighborhood. Go exploring.

Reviews.Title: “great experience for moderate budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: girlfromthesouth
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel tourisme. The room was very clean, the airconditioner worked great, after we figured out how to work it. The location was 20 feet from a good metro, the hostesses were helpful, friendly, and wonderful. It wasn't posh luxury, but for a middle class girl it was great. A neat old building, with character. The halls weren't fancy, but the rooms were thoughtfully decorated and attractive. It felt French not Days Inn. The neighborhood felt safe and although it was busy, it lacked some of the crazied crowdedness that the more upscale, touristy areas seemed to have 24 hours a day. In the evening it was quiet and even peaceful. Grocery store across the street, delicious bakeries on the street, nice cafe bistros. What more could you want for a reasonable price in Paris? I should emphasis how lovely the staff treated me and my boys. They had a breakfast room, but we never took breakfast as I'm not a coffee drinker and the grocery store was much cheaper for our American cereal and milk, and teenage boys can really eat a lot. Everything was crazy expensive in Paris. But there was a little grocery store called the Fran Prix across from the hotel, that was a bit more reasonable. About 100 yards from the hotel was a big store kind of like super target, that had almost any regular item you might need (but they didn't have tennis balls) and that included a big grocery store. I loved walking out of the hotel and being at the metro. And it was a good metro that made getting to all the big spots easy. The walk to the Eiffel tower was lovely, it was only 5 minutes to the park. The park was HUGE. The tower itself was a good 15 to 20 minute walk, but every time I went it was amazing. Although I am sure we walked 10- 15 miles everyday and we were exhausted by 9 every night. Several mornings I was up at 7:00 and took my kids to the park in front of the Eiffel Tower and let them jog around while I "power walked" and it was great. I felt like I belonged to the city in the cool morning, teams of street cleaners, lots of dogs and dog owners. It was like being with a gracious hostess, the morning after a late party, and watching while she picked up and straightened up her beautiful home for another day. And the city really is beautiful. That area of Paris isn't so crowded, but the buildings were gorgeous and it was just nice. Hotel Tourisme is also at the beginning of the Rue de Commerce, which is a long street with a bunch of stores! It was fun to walk down. Again it was crowded but not like the Champs Elysee or the St. Germain area, or Mon Martre or the Marias. Also it was more Parisian middle class people, not tourists and millionares. It had a comfortable feeling, not a show off feeling and the prices were a little closer to the reality that I live. The people were lovely. They were patient while I tried to communicate what I needed or wanted. We never met anyone in the area of the hotel who was even remotely rude or condescending. Parisians in this area were lovely. Although we were on the go every waking second. Several times my boys 13 and 15 asked for a break and we went to the Luxembourg Gardens or Parc du Mars and just hung out. The kids LOVED it. They sat by the big pond at Luxembourg Jardins for an hour or more at a time, ate sandwiches watched people, or just relaxed not being force feed my agenda of history and art. Yet the gardens are a work of art and the Palace and the landscaping beautiful. Plus getting there we pass the Sorbonne, wonderful old buildings, the Pantheon, and the Cluny. I did spluge on the museum pass for 4 days. It was great. I'm not the biggest fan of museums - I get bored and don't care especially when everything is in French and I can't understand a word. And the cost of the museums will knock you out over and over again. But with the pass, you feel ummmm kind of like you need to get your money's worth and that motivates you to go, it is already paid for you don't feel the need to look at everything for hours so you can kind of power visit, teenage boys appreciate that. There are museums all over the city that are free with the pass. Which means almost anywhere you are, you are close to a free, clean bathroom. Which is worth the price itself! Bathrooms in Paris are almost non existent, usually cost money and are stinky and wierd. We powered through alot of museums. Like I would never made a specific trip to the Pantheon but because I had the tourist pass as we walked to the Luxembourg Jardin, I did and it was beautiful, got to see Foucalt's pendulum which was really cool and explore the tombs in the basement, which believe it or not teenage boys think is kind of neat. (Go figure!). The Cluny was neat to see, I especially liked the Roman Ruins which reminded me of a gorgeous spa and I could easily imagine the citizens coming for baths and how relaxing it must have been 2000 years ago. Wish my little town would build a public facility like that! We loved our week at Hotel Tourisme. I completely recommend the Hotel Tourisme and it's wonderful, friendly, helpful staff, imaculately clean and comfortable rooms, it is a great value. I can't imagine a better deal in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: benqt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tourisme Hotel for 3 nights in July. It is a no frills, basic hotel. The room I stayed in was very tidy and most importantly - very clean. For the price of 102 EUR for 3 people in the summertime, it was really a good deal. They had air-conditioning, and free Wi-Fi. It is conveniently located a few steps (literally) from the Metro, about a 7 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower, there is a supermarket across the street, a bakery two stores down, and many cafes and restaurants close by. I found the 3-line Metro to be very convenient. The other hotel I stayed at during my trip was near a Metro that only had one line, and many times, I had to transfer between lines at least once or twice - which can be very tiring and sometimes confusing. Like other reviewers, the downside to this hotel is periodically you will hear the rumbling of a subway because it is so close to the Metro. I stayed on the 3rd floor, and I did hear the rumbling periodically. Its like a muffled rumbling, not very loud, but it is noticeable. It did not bother me at all - but it could be that I live in a big city on a very busy street, so I'm used to street noises all the time. Overall, this hotel is a great find for its value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTT
Reviews.Content: We make reservation "request" online for a stay just two days away. However, they said that they will get back to us in 48 hours. Luckily I was staying in a different hotel at the time, so just drop by. It turns out that the rate they quote to us on the web site is not available (although the web site said yes), but they managed to find a larger room for 10 euros/day more. I took the offer. The staff were friendly, English speaking, and helpful throughout our stay. The room is fairly big in Paris standard and the bathroom is HUGE comparing to the other ones in Paris, and similar to a regular US hotel, say a Hilton (not in NYC). The room decorations are contemporary. It does have a small elevator that allows two persons or one person with bags. Great location at a metro station where three metro lines intersect. A good local bakery next door a few cafe around. There's also a McDonald across street if you have a very tight budget. It's very close to the Eiffel Tower, which is a wonderful location for a picnic at sunset (hint: you can drink wine there). Most important part: THEY'VE GOT AIR-CONDITIONING! Call me spoiled, but I can't sleep during 80+ weather without one. Note: wireless internet is extra but the connection speed is very good (3Mb download). Bottom line: for such short notice in a high-season, it's the best deal we can find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: james_staley
Reviews.Content: You could run out of superlatives describing this hotel given the comparatively low price paid. I can assure you that you will not be able to find a cleaner, friendlier and well located hotel for less in Paris. Can almost guarantee that I will one day return!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's two star rating should be a five star”
Reviews.Author: AlaSlammer
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I unfortunately only had one night in Paris but have no regrets about Hotel Tourisme.The welcome was warm and our room was spacious and comfortable. Nothing was a problem for the staff and they accommodated us with 5 star treatment. We cannot fault the service. Well done and keep up the great hospitality. The location was ideal. Close enough to the Eiffel tower but far enough away to be in an old Paris neighborhood. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DuFFi_SK
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for three nights. Payment and communication with the hotel staff before arrival was without problems. When we arrived to the hotel, the room was not prepared, so we had to wait. Receptionist told us, that we can come back in two hours. After two hours, the room was still not prepared (it was 13:30), so we had to wait another one hour. After that, we finally got the keys from our room. Room was small, but clean and nice looking. We had big LCD TV on the wall. Breakfast was not included in the prices, so we decided to find our own breakfast somewhere around the hotel. It was no problem, because there were lots of patisseries and groceries near the hotel. Hotel has perfect location, just 10 minutes walk from Eiffel Tower. But the best thing is that just few steps from the reception is metro station, where three metro lines are crossing, so you can travell almost everywhere in Paris. It was great, especially in the evening, when we were tired and really appreciated that the metro station was so close. One bad thing was that we heard the noise from the metro every 10 minutes, but it was quiet during the night. And....if you go to the Paris for three and more days, and if you want to see museums and historical sights, you should buy Museum Pass. You can save a lot of time, not standing in the ticket queues.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: JyuuGaTsu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent visit to Paris. Rooms were pretty small but good for the purpose. There was even a TV with several channels although I was out visiting places most of the time and didn't really bother watching anything. I took up the advice and visited the Sunday market. There were alot of stalls, and most of them were selling food. The fruits were fresh, and we bought cherries and meat. I remember the cherries cost around 4 euros per KG but they were pretty delicious. There were so many kinds of meat, and we bought chicken, beef and lamb. I wasn't adventurous enough to try the lapid (rabbit). It could get alittle noisy in the morning due to the traffic. My room directly faced the main street so I was alittle affected. It was surprisingly quiet at night though it is a generally popular street. The location was almost perfect. It was close to the Effiel Tower and you could walk to it anytime of the day. There were also several good restaurants in the area. I remember seeing a Fitness First gym along the same street as well so for you fans of keeping fit, you can try that out when you are staying at the hotel. The station is just in front of the hotel and is connected to 3 metro lines. You can basically get to anywhere in Paris from this hotel easily. Breakfast at the hotel cost 6 euros and is basically a continental breakfast, which is good enough to prepare you for the day and last you till lunch. The people in the hotel speak English well and were really friendly. They never hesitated to help and was always giving recommendations, which was really kind. The price was reasonable for the room, and I would probably come back here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location in Paris center”
Reviews.Author: JDaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with spouse. Great location - bus and metro right out the door. Walking distance to many attractions. Safe at night, with plenty of shops and restaurants. Room was spacious and clean, with a flat screen. Stayed in #104, which is facing the front/busy main intersection, but we enjoyed the people watching and sounds of the streets during the day/early evening. When windows were closed it was quiet enough for us. Bakery just below, so it smelled like bread a lot! High Speed Internet offered off the lobby area at 2 Euro per 40 minutes. Staff was helpful. Overall very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “You don't have to pay a fortune to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: goodolddad
Reviews.Content: I took my wife (her birthday) to Paris for the first time and we stayed 2 nights to take in the main sights. We've been fortunate over the years in being able to stay in some of the best hotels around the world and I was a bit concerned about the Tourisme's 2* rating. I should not have worried!! It's all been said on here by previous reviewers: Location, bistros/cafes on the doorstep, Metro just steps away, comfy rooms, friendly staff, great value etc etc., and it's all spot on. We hope to get back to Paris soon and there is NOWHERE ELSE we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: parvathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Tourisme during a short 2-day stopover in Paris. We called the hotel a couple of times before leaving for France and the staff was courteous and clarified all our questions, in English. Since we had 4 big suitcases, we had the hotel arrange for a shuttle to pick us up from CDG (we ended up taking the shuttle on the day of departure too). Upon arrival, we called the number for the shuttle. Unfortunately, the agent only spoke French - but they were expecting us. It took us about 5 minutes to pin down our location in the terminal and were able to convey the exit number. The shuttle was waiting just outside that door within 5 minutes. The shuttle picked up 2 more couples and we made our way to the hotel. Since we arrived early, we left our luggage under the stairs (outside the small lobby). And off we went to explore Paris by foot. After about 3 hours, we got back and checked into the room. We read that the rooms would be small, and it did meet expectations. The bathroom was much better than we anticipated. The only hitch was that I had to lug each bag separately in the tiny elevator - but it wasn't all that bad. The room ended up being quiet and we could hear the metro trains pass us faintly. Which brings me to the best part about the hotel - the location. Right outside is the entrance to a very clean and safe Metro station. It's connected to 2 different lines - so it's a breeze to get around the city. There's a grocery store right across the street and some very good restaurants on the way to the Eiffel tower (a 10-15 minute walk). We walked around late at night and it felt safe with many tourists around. We were pleasantly surprised the second day when our standard CRT TV was replaced with a big, flat screen TV. Too bad we didn't have the time to enjoy it - there's so much to see in Paris. Overall, it's a great hotel if you're not too fussy about the space and amenities. There were no bellhops. It's just a small hotel, with clean rooms, helpful staff, a very reasonable rate and a fantastic location. More than perfect if you just want to crash in here and spend the rest of the time exploring the City of Lights.

Reviews.Title: “Not a huge fan”
Reviews.Author: daggy61
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tourisme was our 2nd choice for our 3 day Paris stay,i think we should have gone with our first choice. Staff were not all that friendly except for one particular man whose name escapes me.Rooms were not very inspiring but that said the location was very good,just a short stroll to the spectacular Eiffle Tower and other famous landmarks. I,m sure there are many worst hotels to stay in but this one did not meet too many of our expectations. Darren

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tereza_CZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Tourisme for one week. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone who wants to enjoy Paris without spending a fortune on accommodation. Everything was said here...perfect location, helpful staff, very clean... We loved Paris very much and want to go back someday...there´s no need to look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CrazyEU
Reviews.Content: We (my g/f and me - 30 years old) stayed in this hotel for 10 days (May 08 - May 18, 2009) and we are really, really satisfied. Perfect location (English speaking staff which is very rare in Paris, metro station in front of the hotel, Aiffel tower 10 min. on foot, many restaurants and shops in the street where the hotel is located as well as McDonalds across the street, 3 supermarkets literally across the street - tip: there is a Monoprix mall next to McDonalds, don't be confused and think that there are only clothes and a bakery (extremely delicious choco donuts) inside, although there are not any signs, there is a huge supermarket on the 1st floor, very cheap compared to all other shops, etc.). The rooms are OK, spotlessly clean (sheets and towels changed every day), 32' LCD TV)... Another tip: don't have breakfast in the hotel. Although it's only 5 EUR, it's OK but it's the same every day. Go to McDonalds instead, but until 10 a.m. - they have Le petit dej (huge and very tasty breakfast) for 4.50 EUR. In a nutshell - for 82 EUR/night/room, we would absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drhako
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in Hotel Tourisme. We booked the hotel based on reviews on this site, and they were right! We had triple (N:301) not so big but was ok. The shower was tiny also but water was always hot. Metro station is next to the hotel and Effel tower are nearby. The Rue Cler area right by the hotel has some great little cafes and shops. We will definetly come again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: flying_Geo
Reviews.Content: Room was much bigger compared to our previous one. Paid 92 Euros for a twin room (actually it was a double bed + one single bed) as seen from the pictures. Bathroom was decent sized but shower area was a bit small though. Lift was tiny. Max one person with 1 luggage or 2 people w/o luggage. Wifi was 4 euros for 24h or 6 euros for 72hours. Didn't eat breakfast, but as pointed out, many cafes/easteries along the street with a McDonalds right across the street. Caution: the staff at Macs don't really speak English either. Staff that greeted us were polite but not really friendly. Didn't sense the warmness from them. But they did what they had to. Location: Metro stop is literally outside the hotel. The entrance that is. But to walk to the lines, you walk underground for say 5 mins? 3 lines run through. Shopping street Rue Du Commerce has chains like Gap, Zara, H&M Will definitely recommend this hotel for those who want to live near the Eiffel Tower and are on a budget. Room had 32" LCD tv. But had French channels. Didn't bother trying to see if there were any English ones. Only downside: could hear the metro rumbling at night. We were in room 306. But couldn't hear neighbours at all.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean, safe hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: beber1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tourisme Hotel 2 nights and really liked it. It is an old hotel, fairly small, but the service was good and the English speaking staff was helpful. The room was clean and the bathroom with shower and bidet was spotless. There is a small elevator, but the hotel is not particularly wheelchair-friendly or handicap accessible. The location is excellent, directly across the street from the LaMotte Grenelle metro stop. We got there easily from Charles De Gaulle Airport by using the Roissy bus to the Opera stop and then catching the metro to our hotel. If you like to walk, it is a short walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Seine and Invalides. I walked early in the morning and in the evening and it was a safe area. Just on the corner is a bakery, on the other side is a cafe and McDonalds. Market on the same street if you want to self cater. I'll stay here again if I go back to Paris. Don't expect to get any ice though. They reluctantly gave me 3 cubes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for a very nice price”
Reviews.Author: SwedenHelena
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff, the room was small but nice and clean; perfect for our needs i.e sleeping and resting our feet...But the best part is the location of the hotel, it is fantastic! Close to the subway, the Eiffeltower and it is also possible to walk to most of the major sights in Paris if you feel like it and have good shoes. Lots of cafés and restaurants nearby, we had lovely meals at both Café du Commerce and Le Piquet. Just across the street from the hotel is a nice small shoppingstreet, Rue du Commerce, with great shops such as Sephora - and also a Monoprix for all the french delicasies you may want to bring home :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for price...”
Reviews.Author: lyang
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's true. Metro entrance in front, clean and budget simple room with friendly, helpful guest services. Next to the Monoprix, bakeries, cafes, and grocery marts. Lovely walks to Rue Cler Market and to morning/ late night Eiffel Tower viewings. Check-in, check-out was easy and traveling from CDG via RER B was also super easy. Best price around town! (Believe me when we say we looked!) We received rate of 77 Euro per night for a double, shower, no breakfast during high season in May. Only cons are faint noise from Metro, water flushing/ using noises from rooms above, and wet/ watery floors after shower use. (You can just wipe it after.) Bathroom spotless except for.. a little bit of black on shower floor wall. Scratches in room. Who cares.. we're not that picky for 77 Euros in town!! Other info: Internet is 2 Euro for 40 min by hotel computer. Local calls out are 0.25 Euro. Yes, I would recommend this as the perfect stay for singles or couples that want to see Paris and are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Paris. A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: SJDUDE
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms at this hotel and when we arrived, one of the triple rooms is not available so they gave us a double and a single to compensate. We are pleasantly surpised. The rooms are huge by european standards - including the single room. The location is excellent - Metro stop right in front of the door, bistros and brasseries all around, grocery store across the street as well as shopping. Eiffel Tower is just a 10-minute walk away. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our shuttle failed to arrive and the gentleman at the reception helped us arrange alternate transportation to take us to the train station on time. Will definitely be staying at Tourisme the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect find”
Reviews.Author: Principessa18
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a short Bank holiday trip to Paris. We chose Tourisme Hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and were pleased to discover that reviews were right - this hotel was a perfect find. Let me start with location - very central, walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, close to the metro station connected to three main metro lines that can take you anywhere in Paris in no time at all. The area around the hotel has lots of brasseries and bakeries, as well as other shops, anything you might possibly need is within stone's throw away. Perfect. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but rather opted for breakfast in one of many lovely bakeries nearby. Hotel is spotlessly clean and rooms are cleaned daily. Staff are extremely helpful and polite. My husband has recently had knee surgery and needed to apply ice patches on his knee frequently. Staff were more than happy for us to use their freezer and help ourselves to it whenever required. Rooms are good size and very quiet, even with windows open there is very little noise coming from the outside which was perfect for a good night's sleep. All in all a perfect find, highly recommeded and good value too (we paid 82 EUR/night for a double room).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but . . .”
Reviews.Author: wiltshireboy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a short Easter break - mainly on the strength of positive TA reviews - and were really pleased with the location. As mentioned previously, the metro station is right outside and serves 2 good lines - really easy to get to the heart of Paris and to Gare du Nord and Paris CDG. The area around the hotel is also very pleasant, loads of shops, cafes, restaurants - even a Monoprix and McDonalds over the road. It's a nice area to wander around, the Eiffel Tower is about 10 minutes away, same for Rue de Cler and the street markets there (I'd also recommend the Cafe du Marche on that street - very reasonable prices). You can also stroll up to Les Invalides and the Musee de l'Armee in about 20 minutes which we found well worth it. As for the hotel itself, we found it represented very good quality for the price - 102 euros for a triple, the breakfast at 6 euros each was OK (although, I almost hate to admit it but the McDonalds breakfast was probably better value!). I must admit though that I was a bit disappointed with the hotel, I didn't find the staff particularly friendly and our room was very small and a bit tired-looking. Don't get me wrong, I would still probably recommend it and it was spotlessly clean it's just that next time we visit Paris I think we'd probably pay a bit more for a different hotel. One tip - I really wouldn't bother queuing for ages to go up the Eiffel Tower; take a walk around at nightime when it's lit up like a giant lighthouse and the lasers are sweeping across the sky (the first 10 minutes of the hour is when all the lighing effects take place). We went up to the top of the Arc de Triomphe ( a straight metro ride to Etoile) which I found much better, cheaper, less crowded and, on a clear day, really fantastic 360 degree views.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel at a Great Location - Great Value for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Meitali_and_Yacov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 10 nights at the beginning of April, booked the hotel based on reviews on this site, and they were right! A small cute hotel with lovely stuff, the location cannot be better, the metro station is next to the hotel and the great Champ de Mars and eiffel tower are near by. Rue de Commerce (across the street) is great shopping street with all the main chains shops on it, and other nice stores, also there is a grocery shop, supermarket, and mc donalds right next to the hotel. Also there is a nice market next to the hotel every wednesday and Sunday, - Sunday it is mostly food - very good food! - Wednesday it more clothes and other stuff. Do not expect a 4 star hotel for the price, however it is probably the best 2-star we have been to. It is a great value for you money in an expensive city like Paris. Important: We took the superioir room (205) - and it was not big by American stadards however it was just what we needed cosy, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eade
Reviews.Content: Everything everybody has said about this hotel is true! We picked it based on the reviews and were not disappointed. We have had a wonderful five night stay - the room was spotlessly clean; the breakfast was great, access was easy via the metro... and so on. This is a wonderful hotel for people who go on holiday to see the place they have gone to and use the hotel for washing, sleeping and getting an excellent value for money breakfast. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff - can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: papasandnic
Reviews.Content: We are so happy we found this hotel. For the price and location alone - this is your best bet! At night we would walk less than 10 minutes to view the Eiffel Tower and the light show. We loved this little hotel, the staff spoke great English and were VERY helpful with directions, questions, etc. The rooms were always clean and we were on a non-smoking level and didn't smell smoke at all! There were so many cafes, bakeries, and creperies nearby... (when you step outside the hotel go the right and you will see a small little bakery next to the music store... they make wonderful eclairs!) Having the Metro station right outside the hotel was great. Lines 6, 8, and 10 connect right there. Breakfast in the morning was the cheapest in the area (6 euros/pp). Loved loved loved this place! We will definately come back to this hotel when visiting Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Revitalka
Reviews.Content: Can't ask for a better location - the metro was a few steps away. After full day of sightseeing - nothing bits it :) Very cute bakery next to the hotel - sandwiches are amazing! Being not at the touristy center (but still 10-15 minutes walk from the Eiffel tower) this hotel has excellent restaurants, where mostly local Parisians are eating - you can't get wrong with that too :)

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: kalinya_1
Reviews.Content: We found the staff friendly and helpful. The location is excellent: within a 5 minute walk to The Tower, next to 2 Metro lines, with plenty of good restaurants/cafes/bars in the area. Rooms and lift are not large but are all that you need, clean, comfortable and good value. Breakfast was the cheapest we found in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jamaree
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. They go above and beyond for their guests. The bathroom and bedroom is small but clean. The location couldn't be better...Its just a few steps away from the metro. on sunday and wednesday morning there is a charming farmers market around the corner. I was very staisfied with my stay and will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: shtan614
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value, good room size and very nice to have own bathroom with shower. No complaints - would consider this hotel during next Paris visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Tourisme Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 66 Avenue de la Motte-Picquet, 75015 Paris, France
